title: Westad on the Cold War Secondary SAQ

content.question: In your response, be sure to address all parts of the question. Use complete sentences; an outline or bulleted list alone is not acceptable. Using the excerpt, respond to parts a, b, and c. Identify ONE historical development that led to the Cold War. Explain how ONE piece of evidence would support the author’s claim that the Cold War led to ideological conflict. Explain how ONE piece of evidence would support the author’s argument in the second paragraph that “many regions of the world still live with environmental threats, social divides, or ethnic conflicts” inherited from the Cold War.

frqParts.text: In your response, be sure to address all parts of the question. Use complete sentences; an outline or bulleted list alone is not acceptable. Using the excerpt, respond to parts a, b, and c. Identify ONE historical development that led to the Cold War. Explain how ONE piece of evidence would support the author’s claim that the Cold War led to ideological conflict. Explain how ONE piece of evidence would support the author’s argument in the second paragraph that “many regions of the world still live with environmental threats, social divides, or ethnic conflicts” inherited from the Cold War.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
